page.title: 17HALNAKER
page.content:
The village of Halnaker stands on the A285 from Chichester to Petworth. It is a single street on the main road and most of the houses are made of sussex flint. There are no shops but there is a single pub. Halnaker is famous for its windmill that stands high on the downs on Halnaker Hill and can be seen shining white for miles around. The last man who remembers it working has just died aged 92. Halnaker Park is a large arable farm next to Halnaker House. It has a very high flint wall running all around it. All the farmland round the village is excellent arable land. There is also a chicken processing factory at the northern end of the village.
By Adam Hughes
